newsitem.title: USA: RESEARCH ALERT - Jilin Chemical downgraded.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - Jilin Chemical downgraded.

text.p: -- Merrill Lynch said on Monday it had cut its rating for China's Jilin Chemical Industrial Co to intermediate-term neutral from accumulate and to long-term accumulate from buy.

-- Analysts Janet Yang and John Roberts said in a report they had cut their earnings-per-share (EPS) estimates from $1.68 per American Depositary Receipt to $1.03 for 1996 and to $0.70 from $1.64 for 1997.
-- The five-year EPS growth outlook was lowered to five percent from 30 percent and valuation seemed excessive, they said.

-- The analysts predicted a loss in the second half of 1996. "On continued weak commodity chemical prices and 60 percent utilization rates for the new plants during their first year of operation, 1997 will likely be an even tougher year for JCC as higher costs will likely more than offset the volume gain."
-- The company's shares were off two to 15-3/8 in heavy trade on Monday in New York.
